materialComposition.en-UK: The casing of the drill is made from plastic, specifically polycarbonate (PC) or acrylonitrile butadiene styrene (ABS), and features rubber for the handles and non-slip parts. The motor incorporates materials such as copper, steel, and iron, with neodymium magnets. The battery is a lithium-ion (Li-ion) type and includes components made of copper, aluminum, and steel. The electronics involve printed circuit boards (PCBs) composed of copper, tin, and gold, and use lead-free solder.

hazardousSubstances.en-UK:
1. Battery (lithium-ion) contains lithium cobalt oxide (LiCoO2) at 15-20%, graphite (carbon) at 10-15%, and lithium hexafluorophosphate (LiPF6) as the electrolyte at 5-10%. It also includes copper (Cu) at 10-20%, aluminum (Al) at 5-10%, and polyvinylidene fluoride (PVDF).
2. Motor copper (Cu) in the windings at 30-50%, steel and iron (Fe) in the rotor and stator at 40-60%, and neodymium (Nd) in the magnets at 1-5%.
3. Plastic parts are made of acrylonitrile butadiene styrene (ABS) at 20-30%, polycarbonate (PC) at 10-20%, and polyamide (nylon) at 5-10%.
4. Electronic circuit boards contain lead (Pb) in the solder at 2-5%, gold (Au) in connectors and contacts at less than 0.1%, and copper (Cu) in traces and wiring at 10-20%.
5. Gearbox and mechanical parts are composed of steel (Fe) and other alloys at 60-80%.

recyclingInstructions.en-UK:
1. The battery: Drop off the battery at a recognised collection point for lithium-ion batteries.
2. Plastic parts: Sort the different types of plastics (ABS, polycarbonate etc). Recycle the plastics according to local guidelines for plastic waste.
3. Metal parts: Remove all screws, shanks, and other metal parts. Sort the metals (steel, aluminum, copper etc) and drop off at a metal recycling plant.
4. Electronic components: Sort the PCBs, switches and cables. Deliver these components to a specialised electronic waste center.

safetyInstructions.en-UK: Inspect the drill, chuck and any attachments for damage or defects before use. Secure the workpiece with a clamp or vise. Always operate the drill with both hands. Do not wear loose clothing, gloves, rings, or other jewellery, and keep hair tied back.

lifecycleEvents.actionTaken: Cleaning and replacement of defective start/stop switch.
lifecycleEvents.materialsUsed: Lubricating oil, Cleaning agent, New start/stop switch (492290-00)

lifecycleEvents.actionTaken: Cleaning, Replacement of used drill chuck, Check proper functioning of the device and accessories (battery and charger)
lifecycleEvents.materialsUsed: Lubricating oil Cleaning agent New drill chuck (492291-10)

lifecycleEvents.actionTaken: Device inspection: Repair is not possible. Disassembly: Removal of casing, battery, motor, and other components. The battery will be further recycled by BEBAT. Material separation: Plastic, metal, and electronic components. Metal parts: Melted down and reused. Plastic: Plastic parts are processed into new products. Electronic components: Recycled to recover valuable metals such as copper and gold.
